last_episode_to_air.name: We Love Annie
last_episode_to_air.overview: Mr. Landon is Annie's boss at an answering service company.

name: The Courtship of Eddie's Father
overview:
The Courtship of Eddie's Father is an American television sitcom based on the 1963 movie of the same name, which was based on the book written by Mark Toby. It tells the story of a widower, Tom Corbett, who is a magazine publisher, and his son, Eddie, who believes his father should marry, and manipulates situations surrounding the women his father is interested in. ABC had acquired the rights to the story; the series debuted on September 17, 1969, and was last broadcast on March 1, 1972.

Bixby received an Emmy nomination for the show.

episodes.name: Mrs. Livingston, I Presume
episodes.overview: Eddie meets a newly-arrived young starlet, Dolly Daly, during an MGM studios tour, and invites her home to stay with him and Tom - his "kind, generous, and handsome father".

episodes.name: Teacher's Pet
episodes.overview: Tom receives a mysterious note from Eddie's teacher, Miss Allen, saying she wants to discuss him. Fearing the worst, he goes to the school to meet the teacher. He's doubly pleased when he finds out that not only is Eddie a very bright student, but his teacher is young and attractive. The two hit it off immediately, and begin dating. The relationship between his dad and his teacher causes problems for Eddie, who is dubbed the "Teacher's Pet" by his classmates. After Eddie gets in a fistfight with some other boys over things they have said about his father and Miss Allen, Tom and the teacher are forced to reconsider the impact of their romance on Eddie.

episodes.name: And Eddie Makes Three
episodes.overview: Tom is close to proposing to his girlfriend, Lynn Bardman. When Eddie catches a cold and Mrs. Livingston can't take care of him because she's also ill, Tom asks Lynn to play nurse to Eddie for the day. She finds the responsibilities of caring for a child and running a household to be more than she bargained for, however. At the end of the day, Lynn wonders if she is ready to be a good mother to Eddie.

episodes.name: The Littlest Kidnapper
episodes.overview: Eddie decides it isn't fair that Mrs. Livingston is all alone in the world. After precocious Eddie goes into a lengthy explanation about pollenation, he stuns his dad by suggesting that he pollenate Mrs. Livingston - so she can have her own little boy. Tom quickly nixes the idea, but Eddie is determined to provide her with a child. He brings home ("kidnaps") Frank, the perfect Japanese boy he found at school, and announces to a bewildered Mrs. Livingston that he's her new son. The boy's separated parents are brought together when they find their child at the Corbetts'. Tom then lends a listening ear to Frank's father, who is troubled over his crumbling marriage and distant relationship with his son.

episodes.name: The Computer
episodes.overview: Norman convinces Tom to try computer dating - to "bravely submit to mechanizing his libido" - in order to get first-hand information for the magazine article Norman is writing. Tom's computer date, Diane, turns out to be a better match for Eddie than for him, however. Since Eddie is so fond of her, Tom decides he should give her another chance - to see if they are "computable." While Tom stays home with a cold, Diane takes Eddie to her office to see the computer and lets him fill out a dating questionnaire for demonstration. When the computer matches Eddie to her, she and Tom realize why they had been paired up, also.

episodes.name: Pain
episodes.overview: Eddie is reluctant to attend his first day of school, and refuses to stay once he arrives. Although Tom finally convinces Eddie he must return the next day, the transition still proves to be difficult. When a bully makes fun of the fact that Eddie has no mother, Eddie strikes the boy and ends up with a black eye. Tom feels he should protect Eddie from the world a little while longer, and get him a tutor - until Mrs. Livingston points out that this would be unwise. He then decides to use reverse psychology to make Eddie want to go to school. Tom announces to Eddie that he will teach him at home with a rigorous course of study. The plan backfires at first, until Tom plays his trump card - he tells Eddie they will no longer be able to afford Mrs. Livingston if Tom gives up his job to teach him.

episodes.name: Guess Who's Coming for Lunch?
episodes.overview: Eddie wants to invite his new, fatherless friend, Max, over for the weekend. He plays matchmaker for Tom, suggesting that he invite Max's mother, Betty, over for dinner as she drops Max off. Eddie feels she would make a great date for Tom, as she is beautiful, and a "full-grown mother" who is "already broken in". Tom agrees to be set up on this blind date, and invites over both Max and Betty. When Max and his mom arrive at their apartment, however, Tom is surprised to find that Betty is not what he expected.

episodes.name: Bully for You
episodes.overview: Eddie has been having trouble with a bully at school named Joey Kelly, and refuses to fight back even after Tom teaches him the fine art of self-defense through boxing techniques. Tom is puzzled about Eddie's reluctance to defend himself, until he is called to the school and discovers the identity of the bully. When Tom realizes Joey stays at home alone after school, he invites her to their apartment - much to Eddie's dismay. Tom feels that Mrs. Livingston is just the woman to refine the little tow-headed tomboy. During dinner, she teaches Joey to serve Tom and Eddie Japanese-style. But Joey grows increasingly indignant at having to serve Eddie and wait for her own dinner, and finally explodes. Eddie then must decide whether he will follow his father's orders never to hit a girl, or if he will follow Mr. Kelly's advice and "belt her back."

episodes.name: Gentleman Friend
episodes.overview: Spring is in the air, and Mrs. Livingston has been very distracted lately. Tom discovers it's because there is a new man in her life, and he tries to find out all he can about the Japanese businessman, Mr. Sato. When Mr. Sato asks Mrs. Livingston to become his wife, Eddie is upset - he knows this means she will no longer be taking care of him and his father. Then Mr. Sato announces that he and Mrs. Livingston will have to move back to Tokyo after the wedding, causing Mrs. Livingston to reconsider the proposal.

episodes.name: Any Friend of Dad's
episodes.overview: An old college aquaintance of Tom's - Harvey - appears at the Corbetts' front door. Eddie thinks his father's friend is both fascinating and fun, but Tom is annoyed with Harvey's constant reminiscences of their college days and his immature antics. Due to Eddie's pleading and Harvey's manipulation, Tom unenthusiastically invites him to spend the night - which turns into several. Eddie generously gives up his bed to Harvey, telling Tom he wanted to do it because he's such a good friend of his dad's. Tom then finds it awkward to ask Harvey to leave even after he takes advantage of the Corbetts' generosity and wears out his welcome. When Harvey suddenly announces his departure, his kind gestures toward all of them teach Tom an important lesson in friendship.

episodes.name: An F for Mrs. Livingston
episodes.overview: Mrs. Livingston failed her English test, causing Eddie to think she will commit hara kiri to save face.

episodes.name: Member of the Wedding
episodes.overview: Tina proposes to Norman.

episodes.name: A Night Out for the Boys
episodes.overview: An overnight camping trip leads to a Corbett-Lockwood quarrel.

episodes.name: Mother of the Year
episodes.overview: The mothers of the children in Eddie's class are throwing a surprise party for Miss Lister (Pamela Peadon), who is expecting a baby soon. Eddie's friends tell him everyone is supposed to bring something their mothers made for the party. He is dejected, feeling left out that he doesn't have a mother. A solemn Eddie writes Miss Lister a letter saying since he doesn't have a mother all he can offer as a gift is his father.

episodes.name: Who Pulled the Blues Right Out of the Horn?
episodes.overview: Eddie's flamboyant Aunt Kate comes for a visit.

episodes.name: The Library Card
episodes.overview: Eddie loses the very first library book he takes out.

episodes.name: How Do You Know If It's Really Love?
episodes.overview: Eddie is suffering from a case of puppy love

episodes.name: The Road to You Know Where is Paved with You Know What
episodes.overview: A retired school teacher unknowingly alienates Eddie from his father.

episodes.name: They're Either Too Young or Too Old
episodes.overview: Eddie has a crush on his babysitter, who has a crush on Tom.

episodes.name: The Mod Couple
episodes.overview: Mrs. Livingston departs, leaving Eddie and Tom alone.

episodes.name: Guardian for Eddie
episodes.overview: Tom tries to find a future guardian for Eddie.

episodes.name: The Promise
episodes.overview: Tom tries to prevent Mrs. Livingston from being deported.

episodes.name: A Five-Pound Monkey on His Stomach
episodes.overview: Norman has to lose five pounds in two days.

episodes.name: Free is a Four Letter Word
episodes.overview: Tom has been ordered by his boss to fire his best friend

episodes.name: Don't Look Now, But Your Scorpio's Rising
episodes.overview: Tom's nutty secretary has become interested in astrology and quits her job.

episodes.name: Money is a Five Letter Word
episodes.overview: Eddie finds ten thousand dollars.

episodes.name: A Loaf of Bread, a Bar of Soap and a Jar of Peanut Butter
episodes.overview: A story about a little girl whose widowed father is about to remarry.

episodes.name: The Important Word is 'And'
episodes.overview: Tom learns a lesson in what not to do when Eddie joins a boys' club.

episodes.name: I Thought, You Thought
episodes.overview: Tom has to tell Eddie that he has to work on the night of the school play.

episodes.name: The Business Trip
episodes.overview: Tom has to tell Eddie that he has to work on the night of the school play.

episodes.name: Eddie's Will
episodes.overview: A lesson for Eddie about the pain of growing up.

episodes.name: Hello, Mrs. Bessinger, Goodbye
episodes.overview: A free-spirited girl enters Tom's life.

episodes.name: Love is for Sharing
episodes.overview: An Indian orphan teaches Eddie and Tom about sharing.

episodes.name: Who Wants to Sail Down the Amazon, Anyway?
episodes.overview: Eddie's grandfather visits.

episodes.name: When the Shoe Is on the Other Foot, It Doesn't Fit
episodes.overview: A liberated woman has Tom delighted but not in love.

episodes.name: The Secret Box
episodes.overview: Eddie begins to think that he was adopted.

episodes.name: Fear is for Understanding
episodes.overview: Tom tries to exorcise a ghost.

episodes.name: Gifts Are for Giving
episodes.overview: A story about Norman's highly treasured gift.

episodes.name: A Little Get Together for Cissy
episodes.overview: Tom's sophisticated boss Cissy falls for him.

episodes.name: The Ghetto Girl
episodes.overview: Tom tries to help a girl from the ghetto with a chip on her shoulder.

episodes.name: The Hospital
episodes.overview: Eddie gets scared when Tom goes to the hospital for a routine physical.

episodes.name: The Rift
episodes.overview: Tom refuses to buy a horse for Eddie.

episodes.name: The Encounter Group
episodes.overview: Tina expresses her feelings about Tom and Norman in a group encounter meeting.

episodes.name: Dear Mr. Cooper (a.k.a.) Eddie Meets an Astronaut
episodes.overview: Eddie meets Apollo 13 astronaut L. Gordon Cooper in a story about privacy.

episodes.name: The Lonely Weekend
episodes.overview: While Eddie's away, Tom plans to spend the weekend with his girlfriend.

episodes.name: The Magic Mrs. Rickles
episodes.overview: Tina's mother's belief in magic leaves an impression on Eddie.

episodes.name: Discipline is a Four Letter Word Spelled Love
My Son, The Artist
episodes.overview: Tom is taking an art class,sketching nude models. Eddie decides to try the same thing with his new friend,a neighbor girl.

episodes.name: The Candidate
episodes.overview: Tom might be the next member of the school board

episodes.name: Getting Back on the Horse
episodes.overview: Eddie learns to cope with fear.

episodes.name: Tell It Like I'm Telling You It Is
episodes.overview: A small accident causes big legal problems.

episodes.name: A Very Different Drummer
episodes.overview: Tom and Eddie try to convince Norman it is okay to be a kook.

episodes.name: The Bicycle Theft
episodes.overview: A lesson in responsibility for Eddie gets out of hand.

episodes.name: Two's Company
episodes.overview: A divorced couple makes Tom's life miserable.

episodes.name: Happy Birthday To You
episodes.overview: Norman's birthday is coming up and he does not want anyone to take notice, but Tom and Eddie plan a surprise party anyway.

episodes.name: Or Else
episodes.overview: Tina asks Tom for a raise.

episodes.name: Thy Neighbor Loves Thee
episodes.overview: Tom's new neighbors are driving him crazy with kindness.

episodes.name: A Little Red
episodes.overview: A beautiful female editor from the Soviet Union arrives to observe Tom's publishing methods.

episodes.name: A Brave at Natchanoony
episodes.overview: Eddie's first camping trip is a trauma to mother hen Norman.

episodes.name: The Blarney Stone Girl
episodes.overview: Tom meets a charming klutz with an inferiority complex.

episodes.name: Prince Charming
episodes.overview: Eddie's part in the school play requires him to kiss a girl on the lips, which he finds he can't do.

episodes.name: The Choice
episodes.overview: Tom's romance with a lady doctor depends on her choice to either get married or continue her studies abroad.

episodes.name: The Karate Story
episodes.overview: Eddie takes karate lessons so he can defeat the school bully.

episodes.name: Very Young Man With a Horn
episodes.overview: Eddie's saxophone playing is disturbing the bagpiper upstairs.

episodes.name: The Investors
episodes.overview: Tom and Norman invest in an oil well.

episodes.name: It's All Write With Me
episodes.overview: Tom feels his creative writing is causing him to neglect Eddie.

episodes.name: A Little Help From My Friend
episodes.overview: An insurance man proves to be a disastrous house guest.

episodes.name: In the Eye of the Beholder
episodes.overview: A sixteen dollar gift of friendship becomes a $5,000 headache.

episodes.name: Time For a Change
episodes.overview: Tom considers buying a new house that is in need of repair.

episodes.name: We Love Annie
episodes.overview: Mr. Landon is Annie's boss at an answering service company.
